name: LexTimeKeeper
description: An AI‑powered legal time‑keeping assistant that reads attorney activity logs, extracts work descriptions, maps them to billing codes and client agreements, and automatically creates accurate time‑sheet entries for law firms.

tools.name: parse_document
tools.description: Reads a PDF, DOCX or plain‑text file from a given path and returns the extracted raw text as a single string.

file_path.description: Absolute or relative path to the document that contains the attorney activity log.

tools.name: extract_activities
tools.description: Analyzes raw activity‑log text and returns a structured list of individual work items, each with date, attorney, description, duration (in minutes) and optional matter identifier.

raw_text.description: The full text extracted from the activity log file.

tools.name: get_billing_code
tools.description: Looks up the appropriate billing code for a given activity description and client based on the firm’s coding matrix and the client’s agreement.

activity_description.description: Free‑form description of the work performed.

client_id.description: Unique identifier of the client (e.g., Acme Corp = "acme_corp").

tools.name: get_client_agreement
tools.description: Retrieves the billing‑rate agreement for a specific client, including any special caps, discounts, or prohibited codes.

tools.name: create_time_entry
tools.description: Creates a new time‑sheet entry in the firm’s billing system and returns the entry identifier.

attorney_id.description: Unique identifier for the attorney who performed the work.

date.description: Date when the work was performed (YYYY‑MM‑DD).

duration_minutes.description: Length of the activity in minutes.

billing_code.description: Billable code that maps to the firm’s rate schedule.

description.description: Original activity description from the log.

matter_id.description: Identifier of the legal matter or case.

tools.name: generate_summary_report
tools.description: Produces a markdown‑formatted summary of all time entries created for a given date range and optional client filter.

client_id.description: If supplied, limits the report to this client.

examples.description: User asks the assistant to process an April activity log for Acme Corp; the assistant extracts the log, determines billing codes, creates a time entry and returns a confirmation.

messages.content: You are LexTimeKeeper, an AI assistant that converts attorney activity logs into accurate billing entries using the provided tools.
Please process the activity log at /files/April2024_log.pdf for client Acme Corp and create the corresponding time entries.
I will start by extracting the raw text from the PDF.

Raw text extracted (truncated): "2024-04-03 09:15 John Doe Drafted memorandum on § 1983 claim – 45 min – Matter: 2024-001. 2024-04-03 11:00 Jane Smith Reviewed client‑provided contracts – 30 min – Matter: 2024-001. ..."
Now I will parse the raw text into individual activity records.
